section.title: Alert and event categories
section.para: Alerts and events are categorized by the type of activity or condition that triggers them.

table.title: Table: Types of alerts and events

entry.para: Category
Description
Security
Security-related events that are detected by a Symantec Security Cloud agent on a device.
For example, when a virus is detected or security features are disabled.
Licensing
Events that relate to licensing and activation of customer accounts.
For example, when a product trial expires or a subscription is renewed.
System
System-specific events that are generated within Symantec Security Cloud.
For example, when your event services are restarted.
Audit
All events that may be relevant to audits, including many events that also fall into other categories.
For example, when device ownership changes, a user group changes, or an OS is upgraded on a device.
Policy
Events that relate to policy administration.
For example, when a policy is applied to a device or gets out-of-date.
User Behavior (Alert only)
Events that are associated with a specific user and indicate a pattern of high-risk behavior, whether intentional or unintentional.
For example, opening untrusted links in emails or social media, drive-by downloads, or insider threats.
